title: Doug Emhoff, Kamala Harris's more-than-perfect husband
summary: With his wife, a US presidential candidate; his children; and his ex-wife, Doug Emhoff provides a model blended family. This 59-year-old lawyer, a symbol of modern, progressive and feminist masculinity, is the antithesis of Donald Trump. He could become the first first gentleman in US history.

title: Thousands protest across France against the appointment of Barnier as prime minister
summary: The French left took to the streets on Saturday to condemn the president's 'power grab,' after he announced former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier as prime minister on Thursday.

title: Michel Barnier is a PM representing a break in continuity
summary: France's new prime minister is seeking to mark out his differences with Emmanuel Macron, but when it comes to substance, there are few differences between the two men.

title: France vs Germany: Which country is better at reducing greenhouse gas emissions from its factories?
summary: Although the manufacturing sector in Germany is less carbon-intensive than its French counterpart, France benefits from its lower-carbon electricity production, according to a study by the think tank La Fabrique de l’Industrie.

title: Pedro Almodovar wins Golden Lion at Venice Film Festival for 'The Room Next Door'
summary: The Italian festival jury, chaired by Isabelle Huppert, also recognized Nicole Kidman for her role in 'Babygirl' and Vincent Lindon for 'The Quiet Son.'

title: 'The Perfect Couple' on Netflix: Nicole Kidman at the heart of a murder investigation in Nantucket
summary: In the role of the 'grande bourgeoise' that she masters to perfection, the Australian actress is the standout attraction in this otherwise conventional "murder mystery."

title: US Open: Belarusian Aryna Sabalenka wins final against American Jessica Pegula
summary: Pegula went down fighting, recovering from 0-3 and break point down to lead 5-3 in the second set before Sabalenka came through.

title: Lebanon: Alleged Israeli attack kills 3 emergency workers
summary: The cross-border violence has claimed approximately 614 lives in Lebanon, with the majority being fighters and 138 civilians among the casualties, according to an AFP tally.

title: India challenged by China in its 'sphere of influence'
summary: Beijing's rapid ascent to power in the early 21st century has disrupted the balance of power in South Asia, compelling New Delhi to reassess its foreign policy strategy.

title: Palestinian Mahmud Ham wins top prize at prestigious photojournalism festival for Gaza coverage
summary: The 44-year-old photographer and his family left Rafah, in the southern Gaza Strip, in February 2024. Hams has been working for Agence France-Presse in the Palestinian territories since 2003.

title: The Pelicot family's pain and shock at father's multiple rape trial: 'How could we have seen nothing?'
summary: Dominique Pelicot's daughter and daughters-in-law gave emotional accounts of how they learned of the multiple rapes he is now accused of.

title: Trump's sentencing in Stormy Daniels case postponed until after presidential election
summary: The judge in charge of the case justified this new delay by the desire to avoid any suspicion of interference with the November 5 election.

title: Inflation blamed for France's disappointing tourism figures despite the Olympics
summary: The Games enabled hoteliers to make up for a difficult start to the summer, but not all industry professionals came out ahead. There were fewer restaurant and campsite customers than in 2023.

title: The Indian film industry caught up in the #MeToo movement
summary: A report submitted to the Kerala state government in 2019, but only published on August 19, highlights the recurrent sexual assaults suffered by Indian women working for Mollywood.

title: Kosovo reopens two Serbia border crossings after protests
summary: Tensions between Serbia and Kosovo have been escalating for months, exacerbated by a new rule introduced earlier this year that designates the euro as the sole legal currency in Kosovo, effectively banning the use of the Serbian dinar.

title: Mpox: The risk of developing an animal base outside Africa remains limited
summary: The danger of the virus spreading to domestic and wild fauna outside Africa, taken seriously by health authorities, is judged to be fairly low. However, cases of contamination from humans to animals have been documented.

title: Boeing's Starliner capsule returns safely to Earth
summary: The spacecraft, which had malfunctioned during the outbound flight to the International Space Station in June, landed in New Mexico on Friday night. For safety reasons, it did not return with the two astronauts initially flown on board.

title: A new addition to the Ukrainian army's arsenal, the 'dragon drone' fires an incendiary weapon
summary: Since the beginning of September, the Ukrainian Armed Forces have been using a particularly destructive new type of drone. This incendiary weapon is used to set fire to military equipment hidden under vegetation.

title: Germany's postponed microchip plant projects cast doubt on the merits of subsidies
summary: Announcements of semiconductor plant openings have stepped up in recent months in the country, encouraged by an unprecedented subsidy effort. But several of these projects have stalled, against a backdrop of crisis for manufacturers.

title: Park Kyoung-seok, Korea's disability rights warrior
summary: The 63-year-old activist has been fighting for years to make South Korea more accessible to people with disabilities. His civil disobedience actions in the Seoul subway have led to severe repression by his country's authorities.

title: In Lebanon, a dam lies at the heart of allegations of public funds mismanagement
summary: Designed to hold up to 6 million cubic meters of water and supply villages in the region, the Mseilha Dam in northern Lebanon has faced leakage issues since it was filled at the end of 2019. It has now been sealed off.

title: Copenhagen's dream of becoming a low-carbon city
summary: 'Repairing the Earth' (6/6). Denmark's pioneering capital has set itself the goal of becoming carbon-neutral by 2025. It has already reduced its emissions by 75% since 2005. Half of all journeys are made by bicycle, red meat is no longer used in schools, and the city is tackling all sectors to make them greener.

title: 'The notion of overtourism is the contempt of a class'
summary: In an article for 'Le Monde,' consultant Jean Pinard argues that criticism of the overcrowding of certain tourist sites is becoming caricatured. It masks the real issues and serves only to stigmatize working-class travelers, who can't afford to take vacations in more remote or less well serviced locations, outside school vacations.

title: Trump Fictions: Punching operations in 'Invasion U.S.A.' and 'Delta Force'
summary: 'Trump Fictions' (5/6). When the Capitol was stormed, some people thought they recognized 1980s B-movie brawler Chuck Norris among the rioters. Although he firmly denies his presence, his characters, more prone to xenophobia than introspection, could've been there.

title: In Algeria, President Tebboune's main supporter, the army, is working to re-establish a 'red line' contested by the Hirak
summary: In June, President Abdelmadjid Tebboune signed a decree allowing military personnel to head civilian administrations. It's a way of further strengthening the army's influence and keeping its presence out of the public debate.

title: After Barnier's appointment as PM, part of the French left takes to the streets to protest Macron's 'power grab'
summary: Left-wing parties had called for major demonstrations against the president, who they claimed had ignored the results of the legislative elections. Participation was moderate, however, with the Interior Ministry reporting 110,000 people nationwide.

title: Venezuela's opposition candidate flees to Spain
summary: Against a backdrop of political crisis since the July 28 presidential election, Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia, who claimed victory, has flown to Spain on a Spanish military plane.

title: The long relationship between  Arabs and Paris
summary: The French capital has been a fundamental reference point for generations of Arab intellectuals and politicians who have lived, studied or published there.

title: How Paris plans to capitalize on the success of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games
summary: Hoping to encourage patronage in France and abroad, the capital's sites and monuments are planning to host other sporting events.

title: Swimming, a golden activity for your health
summary: A complete, non-impact sport, swimming is beneficial for both prevention and existing chronic illnesses. It can be practiced at any age, as numerous studies have shown.

title: The Chinese Communist Party helps train African elites
summary: To export its model, the state party is backing leadership schools in several African countries.

title: Brazilian musician Sergio Mendes has died aged 83
summary: The composer, who founded the Bossa Rio Sextet with with Paulo Moura, successfully blended bossa nova with American pop, funk and jazz fusion. He died in Los Angeles on Thursday, aged 83.

title: George Clooney and Brad Pitt at the Venice International Film Festival. Does anyone care?
summary: The American acting duo, who star in Jon Watts' new film ‘Wolfs,’ shown out of competition at the Venice Film Festival on September 1, charmed Venice.

title: France's Le Pen urges Macron to hold referendum to break political statemate
summary: Last week the French president appointed the center-right Michel Barnier as prime minister, trying to move forward after snap elections that resulted in a hung parliament.

title: Philippines arrests celebrity pastor sought by US for child sex trafficking
summary: The US Justice Department charged Apollo Quiboloy in 2021 with sex-trafficking of girls and women between the ages of 12 and 25 to work as personal assistants, or "pastorals", who were allegedly required to have sex with him.

title: Surrealism, arte povera, pop art: The hot French autumn exhibitions you don't want to miss
summary: Painting, contemporary art, photography. Le Monde critics' must-see selection of  September shows to save in your diary for the months ahead.

title: Paris 2024: Morocco’s Fatima Ezzahra El Idrissi smashes marathon world record on last day of Paralympics
summary: But China ended once again top of the medals table on Sunday as the Paris Paralympics drew to a close.

title: Rap legend Kendrick Lamar will headline the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show
summary: The rapper will be the headline interval act at the Super Bowl in New Orleans on February 9, 2025.
